intro: Gilia insignis, commonly known as the desert gilia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, such as deserts and rocky soils, and is well adapted to drought conditions. Its leaves are small, narrow, and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind, contributing to its wide distribution.
